Claim: Janta curfew or nationwide for 14 hours will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see a reduction of 40% of cases.
Explaination: There is no scientific proof to the claim as yet, that 14 hours curfew will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see reduction of 40 per cent cases.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Janta curfew or nationwide for 14 hours will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see a reduction of 40% of cases.

Explanation:There is no scientific proof to the claim as yet, that 14 hours curfew will break the chain of coronavirus spread and see reduction of 40 per cent cases.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/social-media-users-give-misleading-twist-pm-modi-janta-curfew-1658195-2020-03-21

Claim: Professor Wong Kin-Chung offers tips to delay the progress of COVID-19: Rinse mouth with cold salty water; drink water and red wine; take Vitamin C; eat chicken soup, shiitake mushrooms, astragalus, codonopsis and ginseng.
Explaination: There is no evidence that those mentioned in the claim can prevent COVID-19. Plus, we are not able to identify Professor Wong Kin-Chung, a medical professor, doctor as well as a nutritionist in the USA, who allegedly made that claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Professor Wong Kin-Chung offers tips to delay the progress of COVID-19: Rinse mouth with cold salty water; drink water and red wine; take Vitamin C; eat chicken soup, shiitake mushrooms, astragalus, codonopsis and ginseng.

Explanation:There is no evidence that those mentioned in the claim can prevent COVID-19. Plus, we are not able to identify Professor Wong Kin-Chung, a medical professor, doctor as well as a nutritionist in the USA, who allegedly made that claim.

https://tfc-taiwan.org.tw/articles/3462

Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo bought private island to escape coronavirus.
Explaination: Ronaldo's management company confirmed it was false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cristiano Ronaldo bought private island to escape coronavirus.

Explanation:Ronaldo's management company confirmed it was false.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472011-Fact-Check-Cristiano-Ronaldo-Did-NOT-Buy-Private-Island-To-Escape-From-Coronavirus-Crisis.html

Claim: Singapore closed a subway station after a case of COVID-19.
Explaination: Authorities denied.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Singapore closed a subway station after a case of COVID-19.

Explanation:Authorities denied.

http://u.afp.com/singaporesubway

Claim: UNICEF advises a certain set of steps to follow for coronavirus.
Explaination: UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientifically backed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: UNICEF advises a certain set of steps to follow for coronavirus.

Explanation:UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientifically backed.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/viral-coronavirus-advisory-is-not-from-unicef-7171

Claim: The government — or specific states such as Michigan or Florida — has mandated that employers and schools close for two weeks.
Explaination: No such announcement has been made. It was apparently a prank.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The government — or specific states such as Michigan or Florida — has mandated that employers and schools close for two weeks.

Explanation:No such announcement has been made. It was apparently a prank.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/coronavirus-prank-falsely-tells-of-workplace-school-closings/

Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-shot-azerbaijan-october-2019-during-anti-government-protest

Claim: People are panicked about a COVID-19 case at the Dakar Airport.
Explaination: this footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from a Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People are panicked about a COVID-19 case at the Dakar Airport.

Explanation:this footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from a Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.

https://observers.france24.com/en/20200313-senegal-coronavirus-debunked-people-panic-covid-19-case-dakar-airport

Claim: Cow dung and cow urine can cure coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Cow dung and cow urine can cure coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

https://fit.thequint.com/fit-webqoof/cow-dung-cow-urine-for-novel-coronavirus-fact-check

Claim: Blowing hot air through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Blowing hot air through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/coronavirus-home-remedies-hairdryer-hot-air-application-true-false-1656975-2020-03-18

Claim: A doctor faints during surgery on a coronavirus patient.
Explaination: The video was published in the Chinese social media WEIBO and it shows a fainting doctor during an open heart surgery. According to the post, the video was recorded in a hospital of Zhotong in Yunnan, China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A doctor faints during surgery on a coronavirus patient.

Explanation:The video was published in the Chinese social media WEIBO and it shows a fainting doctor during an open heart surgery. According to the post, the video was recorded in a hospital of Zhotong in Yunnan, China.

https://www.facebook.com/SpondeoMedia/posts/609054559887183

Claim: This video shows a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China.
Explaination: With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: This video shows a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China.

Explanation:With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus

Claim: Gargling salt water and vinegar will kill the virus.
Explaination: Pulmonologist debunked the memes, and CDC offers real advice about how to say safe.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Gargling salt water and vinegar will kill the virus.

Explanation:Pulmonologist debunked the memes, and CDC offers real advice about how to say safe.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471891-fact-check-memes-with-advice-for-preventing-coronavirus-are-not-accurate.html

Claim: “Slices of lemon in a cup of hot water can save your life. The hot lemon can kill the proliferation of” the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no scientific evidence that lemon can treat or prevent the coronavirus. Health officials have debunked the claim. The video comes from a man who promotes alternative health information on YouTube.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Slices of lemon in a cup of hot water can save your life. The hot lemon can kill the proliferation of” the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no scientific evidence that lemon can treat or prevent the coronavirus. Health officials have debunked the claim. The video comes from a man who promotes alternative health information on YouTube.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/24/chain-message/facebook-messenger-video-falsely-claims-hot-lemon-/

Claim: Filipinos are eating a bat soup in Wuhan.
Explaination: YouTubers made the video last July in Palau.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Filipinos are eating a bat soup in Wuhan.

Explanation:YouTubers made the video last July in Palau.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200130-intox-chine-soupe-chauve-souris-rumeur-origine-coronavirus?check=5

Claim: A video purportedly showing COVID-19 victims in body bags strewn across the floor of a New York hospital was shared several thousand times in multiple languages on social media.
Explaination: The claim is false; the key footage was shot in Ecuador, not Manhattan, and a US healthcare spokeswoman said the allegations amounted to “abhorrent misinformation.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video purportedly showing COVID-19 victims in body bags strewn across the floor of a New York hospital was shared several thousand times in multiple languages on social media.

Explanation:The claim is false; the key footage was shot in Ecuador, not Manhattan, and a US healthcare spokeswoman said the allegations amounted to “abhorrent misinformation.”

https://factcheck.afp.com/covid-19-corpses-video-was-shot-ecuador-not-new-york

Claim: Holding your breath can let you test whether you may have COVID-19.
Explaination: Holding your breath for 10 seconds is not a valid way to test if you may have COVID-19, and the World Health Organization recommends testing by qualified health professionals.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Holding your breath can let you test whether you may have COVID-19.

Explanation:Holding your breath for 10 seconds is not a valid way to test if you may have COVID-19, and the World Health Organization recommends testing by qualified health professionals.

https://pesacheck.org/false-holding-your-breath-is-not-a-proven-self-check-test-for-covid-19-e51a6e58353a?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Israel has manufactured the coronavirus vaccine
Explaination: According to Israel, work at The Biological Institute is going on and it may take time. 50 of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The Image which is being circulated along with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Israel has manufactured the coronavirus vaccine

Explanation:According to Israel, work at The Biological Institute is going on and it may take time. 50 of the most senior researchers and scientists are working hard to prepare a vaccine. The Image which is being circulated along with the claim is a reference image, available on shutterstock.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15198596

Claim: “Every election year has a disease” — SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.
Explaination: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Every election year has a disease” — SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.

Explanation:Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/11/facebook-posts/no-connection-between-us-national-elections-and-in/

Claim: Hold your breath for 10 seconds to check if you have the coronavirus.
Explaination: The fact is that most young COVID-19 patients will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds, while on the other hand, many elderly without the virus won't be able to do it.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Hold your breath for 10 seconds to check if you have the coronavirus.

Explanation:The fact is that most young COVID-19 patients will be able to hold their breaths for much longer than 10 seconds, while on the other hand, many elderly without the virus won't be able to do it.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-coronavirus-hold-breath-1658725-2020-03-23

Claim: Queen Elizabeth II is infected with the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Buckingham Palace has only confirmed that Prince Charles is infected with COVID-19. There has never been an official announcement about the Queen.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Queen Elizabeth II is infected with the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Buckingham Palace has only confirmed that Prince Charles is infected with COVID-19. There has never been an official announcement about the Queen.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-rainha-isabel-ii-esta-infetada-com-o-novo-coronavirus/

Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.
Explaination: Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Whether countries with high rates of childhood vaccines were hit hardest by coronavirus.

Explanation:Some of the countries with the lowest spread of the virus are those that have higher vaccination rates than the United States.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-countries-with-high-rates-of-childhood-vaccinations-are-not-hardest-hit-with-coronavirus.html

Claim: Coronavirus is found in crab legs.
Explaination: Image did not actually come out of real broadcast with typos, and came from an app that let people make their own stories.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus is found in crab legs.

Explanation:Image did not actually come out of real broadcast with typos, and came from an app that let people make their own stories.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471923-fact-check-coronavirus-has-not-been-found-in-crab-legs.html

Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.
Explaination: Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.

Explanation:Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-was-this-major-accident-averted-due-to-lockdown-in-delhi-1-1175380.html

Claim: Coronavirus is just “the damn flu.”
Explaination: Coronavirus and the flu do have similarities in spread and symptoms, but there are huge differences in the death rate and ability to treat coronavirus.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Coronavirus is just “the damn flu.”

Explanation:Coronavirus and the flu do have similarities in spread and symptoms, but there are huge differences in the death rate and ability to treat coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/david-clarke-jr/former-sheriff-david-clarke-rants-coronavirus-just/
